text: The Thuraiyur Regulated Market would procure cotton and onions directly from farmers from the first week of January. While cotton would be procured on Wednesdays, onion procurement would be on Fridays. Cotton procurement would begin on January 6 and onions would be procured from January 8, an official release said. The procurement would be done through indirect auction and farmers need not pay any commission, the release added. Meanwhile, 879 banana bunches were auctioned at the Integrated Market Complex for Banana at Thiruchendurai in the district on Tuesday. Poovan variety fetched a maximum of Rs.115 a bunch, karpooravalli Rs.70 and pachaladan Rs.85 a bunch.
title: Cotton, onion procurement
